Proper Relation of Parents to 
               the Schools 

                                               -
 


     "Then, whenever a school is established, there should be warm hearts to take a lively interest in our youth. Fathers and mothers are needed with warm sympathy, 
                                                                           10
and with kindly admonitions, and all the pleasantness possible should be brought into the religious exercises."--C. E., p. 47.
